sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russian Defence Minister accuses Ukraine of plotting to detonate a dirty bomb and blame it on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Zelensky, however, dismisses claims as false.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Richie Sunak is the clear front-runner in the race to become the UK's next Prime Minister, as Boris Johnson rules himself out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iranians clash with police in sixth week of rampant protest, while thousands gather in Washington DC in solidarity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu has accused Ukraine of planning to detonate a radioactive dirty bomb and blame it on Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dirty Bomb and blame it on Moscow. Shoigu discussed what he described as the rapidly deteriorating situation in the Ukraine war over phone calls with NATO nations on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Without providing evidence, Shoigu told his French, British and Turkish counterparts of Russia's concerns, issuing a statement after his phone calls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A dirty bomb is a device that uses explosives to scatter radioactive waste.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It does not have the devastating effect of a nuclear explosion, but it could expose large populations to radioactive contamination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Shoigu also held phone talks with U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin for the first time since May. In his nightly address, Ukraine's President Vladimir Zelensky immediately hit back, accusing Moscow of blatant lies. He says if Russia calls and says that Ukraine is allegedly preparing something it only means one thing Russia has already prepared it. I believe that now the world should react as harshly as possible. Meanwhile the situation in Kyiv remains tense and whatever the likelihood of a dirty bomb attack the back-and-forth accusations hold their own dangers of escalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian-installed authorities in Kherson have told the region's inhabitants to leave the area immediately,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: as Kyiv continues to advance its counter-offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow took control of the region in the early stages of the war, and it has now moved its key military personnel across the Dnipro River, according to the Institute of War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow-installed officials announced plans to evacuate around 60,000 civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They say that they have already moved around 25,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Kyiv has accused Moscow of conducting mass deportations of its population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But reporters from France Television met people gathering to cross the river.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They claimed the majority of the people they spoke to supported the Russians and insisted that they were not forced to leave Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They have taken what they could.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The car, the stuff from our lifetime, there's nothing left.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: lifetime, there's nothing left. Over one million homes are without power in the country following Russian strikes on energy infrastructure. And several regions are now obliged to restrict their energy consumption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Whole streets of Kharkiv have been plunged into darkness. One man describes what life in the city is now like.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: After the electricity is cut off, not all the stores work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The stores that work are only those that accept cash and those that have a personal generator.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Many Ukrainians have voluntarily restricted their energy consumption by around 5 to 10 percent, according to the country's energy provider.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Rishi Sunak could be installed as UK Prime Minister in the next few hours after Boris Johnson dramatically abandoned hopes of a return to No. 10 Downing Street on Sunday evening. The former Chancellor has already cleared the threshold of 100 MPs. The deadline to declare support is 1400 hours UK time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: His only rival now is Penny Mordaunt, who is said to be a long way off securing the magical total of 100 MPs, which would force a ballot of members in the days ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson's sudden decision to rule himself out of the race to replace Liz Truss surprised many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In a statement he insisted he did have enough support but he had decided it was not the right thing to go ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He conceded he would struggle to unite his party in Parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: His claim of having 102 backers has not been verified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Most observers believe Sunak is now firmly on course for Downing Street, just seven weeks after he was roundly defeated by trusts in the last Tory leadership contest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Victory would see him installed as Britain's first ever Hindu Prime Minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: French President Emmanuel Macron became the first foreign leader to hold talks with Italy's new Prime Minister, Giorgio Maloney.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They met on Sunday as Macron carried out an official visit to Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Through an informal meeting, the pair discussed various European issues, including energy, migration and Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: European issues, including energy, migration and Ukraine. In a tweet afterwards, Macron said the pair had apparently vowed to work together with dialogue and ambition as Europeans and neighbors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier Meloni, who's Italy's first female prime minister, was sworn in as the country formed its first far-right government since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meloni's Brothers of Italy party, which has neo-fascist roots, came first in last month's national election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But it didn't win enough votes to govern outright, meaning Maloney had to turn to her two main right-wing allies, Matteo Salvini and former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Right-wing former Foreign Minister Andrzej Logar has won the most votes in Slovenia's first round presidential election. But he will face his centre-left rival Natasha Pirc-Mussar in a run-off. Electors in the small Alpine EU country of 2 million people chose from seven candidates standing for the largely ceremonial post.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A second round will now take place in November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dozens of volunteers have been cleaning up the sea floor and parts of the beach in the popular Egyptian tourist spot of Sharm el Sheikh.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Everything from single-use plastic materials to metals and tyres were collected from the sea floor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The campaign comes weeks ahead of the UN's COP27 conference in the Red Sea Resort in November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: China's President Xi Jinping is now all but certain to sail through to a third term as the country's leader,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: re-elected head of the Communist Party and cementing his place as the nation's most influential ruler since Mao Zedong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On behalf of the CPC new central leadership, Xi says, I wish to thank the whole party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We'll keep in mind the party's nature, our own mission and responsibility, and work diligently in the performance of our duties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Appointing Xi as its general secretary for a precedent-breaking five-year term tilts the country decisively back towards one-man rule, after decades of power-sharing among its elites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The CCP also named a seven-member Politburo Standing Committee led by Xi, an inner circle of power dominated by the party's allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He will be formally announced president during the government's annual legislative sessions in March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The women-led protests in Iran entered their sixth week on Sunday

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: as university students braved a military crackdown to challenge the government by holding rallies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, clashes broke out between police and students at a prominent university, where male and female students on Saturday had sat next to each other at the university's restaurant in defiance of the gender segregation rules of the Islamic Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, there have been solidarity protests, including one in Washington, D.C., where thousands of people, many of them Iranian, marched chanting justice for Iran and carrying banners that read, Women, Life, Freedom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My brothers and sisters back in Iran, they are on the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They're fighting for their life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm in a free country, and this is my obligation to talk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Iran's anti-government protests were first sparked after the death of Massa Amini, died days after she was detained by the country's morality police for not abiding by the mandatory hijab dress code.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Climate protesters in Germany have thrown mashed potatoes at a painting by Claude Monet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's the latest artwork to be targeted by environmental activists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The activists from the group Last Generation also glued themselves to the wall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Barberini Museum in Potsdam said on Sunday that because the painting was enclosed in glass, the mashed potatoes didn't cause any damage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The painting, which is part of Monet's Haystack series, is expected to be back on display later this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Earlier this month, activists from the British group Just Stop Oil threw soup at a painting of sunflowers by Vincent van Gogh, housed in the National Gallery in London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The last generation and Just Stop Oil are calling on governments to take drastic action to protect the climate and stop using fossil fuels.
